attributes.action: A bigger better bus service in Law, South Lanarkshire
attributes.additional_details: In Law it's a small village in the middle of nowhere and 50% are elderly and 25% of those elderly can't drive so they rely heavily on the unreliable bus service and there is only one bus that runs through the village once a hour
attributes.background: To fix a small park in Law, South Lanarkshire and to get a better bigger bus service

rejection.details:
The provision of bus services in Scotland is a matter for local authorities and the Scottish Government. This means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into this issue for you.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out how to do this here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
